intro: Amauropelta cheilanthoides, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Pteris and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically clustered around the base. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping stems that allow it to spread along rocky or sandy soils. Its fronds are usually evergreen, maintaining a green color throughout the year. Amauropelta cheilanthoides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or on rock faces.
